thread.title: Oxlade-Chamberlain 'likes' a call for Arsene Wenger's ouster and then backpedals

title: Oxlade-Chamberlain 'likes' a call for Arsene Wenger's ouster and then backpedals
text:
Feb 4, 2017 at 4:28p ET 0Shares 
Ah, the â€œlikeâ€ function on Twitter. It can mean a lot of things. It can mean, â€œI think that was a good tweetâ€ or â€œYes, I agree.â€ It can be used to bookmark a tweet you want to go back to later. 
Or, to hear Arsenal midfielder Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain tell it, it can simply be the result of an accidental tap. 
Oxlade-Chamberlain has publicly backpedaled after fans noticed he â€œlikedâ€ a tweet calling for manager Arsene Wenger to be sacked after Arsenalâ€™s loss to Chelsea on Saturday. 
The disputed â€œlikedâ€ tweet came shortly after Chelsea easily beat Arsenal, 3-1, which of course led to unhappy calling for Wenger to be dismissed on social media. Oxlade-Chamberlain seemed to endorse a message saying â€œWENGER NEEDS TO GO!!!â€ from a fan account called Arsenal Fan TV via the â€œlikeâ€ button. Oxlade-Chamberlain's recent like ğŸ˜³ğŸ˜³ pic.twitter.com/BfEY8akEaN 
Fans quickly spotted it and the Arsenal midfielder, who started at Stamford Bridge in Saturdayâ€™s loss, retracted the â€œlikeâ€ and publicly announced that it was merely an accident. I didn't mean to like that post earlier obviouslyâ€¦ Didn't even realise I had! 
â€” Alex Ox-Chamberlain (@Alex_OxChambo) February 4, 2017 
Some fans are taking him at his word, while others â€“ either due to wishful thinking or genuine skepticism â€“ arenâ€™t. Either way, Saturday wasnâ€™t a great day for the Gunners and Wenger, as they now sit 12 points behind the league-leading Chelsea.
